name: times
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 multiplied by: Two times two equals four (2 × 2 = 4). The area of a rectangle is its height times its width.

B1 used to show the difference in amount of two things, by multiplying one of them by the stated number: She earns five times as much as I do./She earns five times more than I do. My foot swelled up to three times the normal size when it was stung by a wasp. ten, a hundred, etc. times better, longer, etc. informal
much better, longer, etc.: This work is ten times better than the last piece you did.

times preposition

used to show the difference in amount of two things, by multiplying one of them by the stated number: She earns five times as much as I do.
